alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 02 at 1:37PM MST until September 02 at 9:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Paria River in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 930 PM MST Saturday /1030 PM MDT Saturday/. * At 133 PM MST /233 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Paria River. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Paria River. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Paria River. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Paria Canyon, Paria River Slot Canyon, White Pocket, Lee`s Ferry, Vermilion Cliffs National Monument, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Grand Canyon National Park and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following slot canyons... Paria River upstream of Lees Ferry. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Paria River and Colorado River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Get out of the Paria River slot canyon! Flood waters will flow down the Paria River, likely reaching the confluence with the Colorado River at Lees Ferry between 8 PM and 9 PM MST or 9 PM and 10 PM MDT.
